main event: Major William J. Hampton observed an unusual aerial phenomenon at Vaughan, New Mexico, on 5 March 1950.
interesting points: The object was white, round like a ping pong ball, and appeared 75 to 100 miles away from the observers., The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 180 to 200 miles per hour., It remained in view for approximately 1 hour and 25 minutes before diminishing in size and disappearing into the clouds., No exhaust or sound was observed from the object during the sighting., Multiple witnesses, including professional photographers, observed the phenomenon.
witness description: Major William J. Haynor and five other military personnel
